text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Supplementary Welfare Allowance) (Amendment) (No. 4) (Calculation of 
Means) Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations 

(Consolidated 
Supplementary Welfare Allowance) Regulations 2007 to 2022 shall be 
construed together as one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare 
(Consolidated Supplementary Welfare Allowance) Regulations 2007 to 2022. 

the Social Welfare 

and 

Assessment of means

title: Pensions Act 2010 (No. 37 of 2010)) in Table 2 to Schedule 3 to, the Social
heading: 2. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Supplementary Welfare Allowance)
text_raw:
2. The Social Welfare (Consolidated Supplementary Welfare Allowance) 
Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 412 of 2007) are amended in article 36 (amended 
by article 2 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Supplementary Welfare 
Allowance) (Amendment) (No. 3) (Calculation of Means) Regulations 2022 – 

(a) by the deletion of “or” after paragraph (h), 

(b) by the substitution of “person,” for “person.” in subparagraph 

(iii) of paragraph (i), 

and 

(c) by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph (i): 

“or 

(j) any financial contribution paid by the Minister in 
accordance with section 8(1) of 
the Civil Law 
(Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2022.”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 6th September, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the foregoing 
Regulations. 

[431] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 July, 2022. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 July, 2022. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [431]

title: Pensions Act 2010 (No. 37 of 2010)) in Table 2 to Schedule 3 to, the Social
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide that a person who receives a financial contribution 
payment in accordance with section 8(1) of the Civil Law (Miscellaneous 
Provisions) Act 2022, in respect of hosting a temporary protection beneficiary, 
(as defined in section 4 of the Act), will be disregarded in the assessment of 
means for the purposes of Supplementary Welfare Allowance. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [431] 5
